item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAt a time when tensions over race are high, the Department of Justice announced it will cancel all diversity...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAt a time when tensions over race are high, the Department of Justice announced it will cancel all diversity and inclusion trainings for its staff.

immigrationimpact.com

Department of Justice Eliminates Diversity and Inclusion Training for All Immigration Judges

At a time when tensions over race are high, the Department of Justice announced it will cancel all diversity and inclusion trainings for its staff.At a time when tensions over race are high, the Department of Justice announced it will cancel all diversity and inclusion trainings for its staff.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Human ServicesIf you have been financially impacted by #COVID19, have a child living with you at home,...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Human Services

If you have been financially impacted by #COVID19, have a child living with you at home, and make up to $75,000/year, you may qualify for up to $4,000 in emerge...ncy assistance.

This money can be used to pay rent/mortgage, cover home or auto repairs, pay medical or mental health bills, buy food, and more!

To apply, visit https://coloradopeak.secure.force.com and apply for Colorado Works/TANF by clicking “Apply for Benefits”. Questions? Call 720-944-4DHS (4347).

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeRight To The City AllianceIndigenous and Tribal Sovereignty is the first plank of this Orientation. What you...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeRight To The City Alliance

Indigenous and Tribal Sovereignty is the first plank of this Orientation. What you see here are the main points of that plank, generated by our allies of the In...digenous Environmental Network. In order to visualize a better future, we must redirect our minds away from the capitalistic systems that harm our Grandmother Earth, our Father Sky, and our communities. To learn more visit: https://www.ienearth.org/regenerativeeconomy/

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudSweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

Sweeps Scheduled for Tuesday (9/29) and Wednesday (9/30): When will this Move along To NOWHERE End…

There are two more sites where people without housing live t...hat are slated to be swept next week. 21st and Market/Blake is currently home to about 60 people without housing - some of whom have been living for months, some who moved there recently from the 22nd st sweep or the 25th st sweep. This site was posted for a sweep the same day as residents from 25th and Arapahoe moved to this site in search of anywhere to be. 25th and Welton is currently home to another 60 or so people without housing. Most of the residents on the right of way strip on 25th have been living there for many months. Others living in the parking lot area have moved there recently after other sweeps.

Residents of these encampments all ask the same question: where are we supposed to go?? The City has done nothing to get these people access to housing. They are not even being offered hotel rooms through the COVID FEMA funding. They are being told to either go to a shelter or go to jail.

Come support residents of these encampments as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords/Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 7am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeThe Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeThe Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions

coloradopolitics.com

Denver clears path for zoning change that could free up land for managed homeless campsites

The Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansionsThe Denver City Council is considering a temporary zoning amendment that would liberate land restricted under “old” zoning code for emergency uses, such as city-sanctioned homeless encampments and outdoor expansions
